messages: eb8a98129bf103327310edbb5652fcee (00:42): Wow, chatty around here.
78885357e970c69de0c33081760a04c9 (00:47): watches a dustball roll past
eb8a98129bf103327310edbb5652fcee (01:03): hey Maciej
eb8a98129bf103327310edbb5652fcee (01:04): is afk
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:05): tries to find a solution to the <figure> <legend> impasse
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (01:07): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: what are the constraints again?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:08): suggested <label> before
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (01:09): Will label work outside forms / for AT?

e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:09): "ok everyone's homework now is to come up with a solution for <figure> that introduces a caption without introducing a new element, without using anything that can be mistaken for prose content, without breaking forms or outlines, with a good default presentation, and that is compatible with styliing in legacy UAs."
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:13): <h1> works
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:14): (not in Firefox though, if they won't fix that bug...)

b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (01:15): <h1> seems unnecessarily ugly. Moreso than just specifying that the lat child of the <figure> is the caption, for example (and the default styling is wrong too)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:15): <label> doesn't work because it would make putting form controls in figure labels very annoying
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:16): <figure><p><img></p><p>caption</p></figure> wfm
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:16): <h1>-<h6> doesn't work because it breaks the outlining algorithm, and <h1>-<h5> has bad styling for it
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:16): outlining algorithm special cases <blockquote> already, could do the same for <figure>
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:16): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: but then you are forced to put the caption in a defined place, and you can't easily put multiple paragraphs into a figure
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:17): true
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (01:17): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: Well CSS should solve layout issues :-p
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:17): i guess we could use <h6> and hard-code figures into the outlining
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:17): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: i meant in the markup, not in the layout
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (01:18): I'm not sure why it's  problem if the markup has to be in a certain order
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:18): true
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:18): the alternative of course is <figure> <legend><span class="legend">...</span></legend> ... </figure>
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:19): with css for   figure > legend, figure > .legend
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:19): which works pretty well both now and in the figure
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:19): future even
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (01:20): (fwiw, I think that I would prefer a new element over <h6> since using h6 doesn't make any conceptual sense for authors learning the language)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:20): yeah i don't like h6
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:20): a 14th element for making titles is so not an option
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:21): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea, that also applies to the current usage of h1
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:21): <dt> doesn't work in IE
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:21): it simply ignores the end tag
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (01:21): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: You mean for headings? I think that makes some sense
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:23): <p><b> :)
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:24): or <i> might be better...
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (01:26): <p><b> could be mistaken for prose content
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (01:29): <figure aria-describedby="anyotherelementonthepage"> - see no need for a caption at all ;)
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:31): <figure><p role=caption>....</p></figure> ftw
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:33): once a browser implements something like that, let me know
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (01:35): wonders if Firefox + Orca counts
